VI.iii.1.B.2.c
.
Avoiding Unnecessary Apportionment Development
Do
not
routinely take the actions described in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.2
in connection with a request for an apportionment of benefits withheld due to incarceration.  Such actions are usually unnecessary and not required because the
notice of proposed adverse action issued in accordance with Step 17 of the procedure described in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.A.3.a
will have informed the Veteran of eligible family members’ rights to an apportionment of benefits withheld due to incarceration
Veteran’s monthly rate of payment will not be adversely impacted by any apportionment authorized to the dependent(s), and
VA Form 21-0788
required to request an apportionment will adequately portray factors material to apportionment consideration, including the income and living expenses of the dependent(s) at issue.
References
:  For more information about
determining the amount of compensation to apportion to an incarcerated Veteran’s dependent, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.B.2.h
, and
the regulatory authority for apportioning incarceration withholdings, see
38 CFR 3.665(e)
.
